?_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
?_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area, also known as the equivalent thickness of sea ice.

evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report sidmassevapsubl as zero as long as the ice is snow covered, and to report any sublimation within the variable sisndmasssubl.
evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation

fsitherm_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is positive when fresh water enters the ocean, and is therefore negative during ice growth and positive during ice melt.

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
hfls_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
hfss_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Net Downward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice

prra_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. If the rain is directly put into the ocean, it should not be counted towards sipr. Always positive or zero.

rlds_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rlds_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice

rlus_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Upward longwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rlus_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Downwelling shortwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice

siage_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.

siarea_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

siareaacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

sicompstren_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P = P\* h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h is ice thickness, A is compactness and C is strength reduction constant.

siconc_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Areal fraction of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

siconcitd_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
siconcitd_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.).
sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics

sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes.
sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics

sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.comment: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.long_name: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field

sidmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.

sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always positive or zero since sea-ice melt is collected in sidmassmeltbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth

sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion

sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)

sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting/dissolution at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always zero or negative since sea-ice growth is collected in sidmassgrowthbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting

sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through lateral melting/dissolution divided by grid-cell area (report zero if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically). Always negative or zero.
sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting

sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area. This number is independent of the actual fate of the meltwater, and will hence include all sea-ice meltwater that drains into the ocean and all sea-ice meltwater that is collected by a melt-pond parameterisation. Always negative or zero.
sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting

sidmassth_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sidmassth_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area.

sidmasstranx_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

sidmasstrany_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

sidragbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice.

sidragtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice.

siextent_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

sifb_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.

siflcondbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
siflcondbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base

siflcondtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
siflcondtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface

siflfwdrain_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean divided by grid-cell area. This combines both surface meltwater that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt ponds. By definition, this flux is always positive.

siflsaltbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.

siflsensbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.
siflsensbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice

siflswdbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice, i.e. the amount of shortwave radiation that penetrates the sea ice and reaches the sea ice-ocean interface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
siflswdbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice

siforcecoriolx_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
siforcecoriolx_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforcecorioly_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
siforcecorioly_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

siforceintstrx_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
siforceintstrx_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforceintstry_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
siforceintstry_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

siforcetiltx_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
siforcetiltx_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforcetilty_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
siforcetilty_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

sihc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sihc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water. Note that the CF standard name is incorrect since heat content is not only function of temperature but also of salinity, plus the link with temperature is not linear. A new CF standard name is currently being proposed to address this issue (https://github.com/cf-convention/vocabularies/issues/253).

simass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
simass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

simassacrossline_tavg-u-ht-u.comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

simpconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.
simpconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond

simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

simprefrozen_tavg-u-hxy-simp.comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.
simprefrozen_tavg-u-hxy-simp.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond

simpthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

sirdgconc_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.

sisali_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.

sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.
sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice

sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.comment: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.long_name: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field

sisndmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to sea ice dynamics (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.
sisndmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics

sisndmassmelt_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
sisndmassmelt_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt

sisndmasssi_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
sisndmasssi_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion

sisndmasssnf_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to solid precipitation (i.e. snowfall) falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

sisndmasssubl_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass through sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report all sublimation within sisndmasssubl as long as the ice is snow covered.
sisndmasssubl_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation

sisndmasswind_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to wind-driven transport into the ocean divided by grid-cell area.
sisndmasswind_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow

sisnhc_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.
sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South

sisnmass_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This then allows one to analyse the storage of latent heat in the snow, and to calculate the snow-water equivalent.

sisnmassacrossline_tavg-u-ht-u.comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

sispeed_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice.

sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.comment: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.long_name: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice

sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.comment: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.long_name: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice

sistrxdtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.
sistrxdtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice

sistrxubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.
sistrxubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice

sistrydtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.
sistrydtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice

sistryubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.
sistryubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice

sitempbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.

sithick_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

sithickitd_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).
sithickitd_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

sithickrdg_tavg-u-hxy-sir.comment: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.

sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.
sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice

siu_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

siv_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

sivol_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

snc_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Area fraction of the sea-ice surface that is covered by snow. In many models that do not explicitly resolve an areal fraction of snow, this variable will always be either 0 or 1.

sncitd_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
sncitd_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

snd_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
snd_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

snditd_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.
snditd_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

ts_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

tssi_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.
